title: Overheight DJ vehicles stopped in U.P.'s Meerut, modified to meet Kanwar Yatra safety norms
content: As many as 55 DJ setups were found to have heights ranging from 12 to 16 feet, posing a significant risk to overhead power lines, traffic flow and public safety

title: First phase of Shanthipuram colony redevelopment to get under way soon
content: The project to follow the concept of Pocket Homes, an innovative social housing project designed to optimise space and foster community engagement along a linear axis

title: Neither electricity nor bill will come: U.P. Energy Minister on Bihar CM Nitish Kumar’s free electricity announcement
content: Janata Dal (United), a key ally of the BJP hit back at the U.P. Minister asking him to visit U.P.-Bihar border villages to get reality check

title: Chirag Paswan recalls RJD’s rule, blamed Lalu-Rabri for Bihar’s backwardness
content: Without naming anyone, the Union Minister alleged that there are people who want to end his political career. Mr. Paswan claimed that many political parties are afraid of him and they cannot tolerate him

title: L-G office’s push for including Sanskrit in J&K schools not approved yet: J&K govt
content: A government spokesman said the L-G Secretariat had received a representation from Purshotam Lal Dube, who heads a non-governmental organisation, for inclusion of Sanskrit in the schools and colleges of J&K under the provisions of NEP 2020

title: Uttarakhand creating history in development and growth, says Amit Shah
content: Praising CM Pushkar Singh Dhami, the Union Minister said bringing investments to hilly regions is as challenging as climbing a mountain but it was achieved by Mr. Dhami as he broke traditional perceptions

title: Pachapadra oil refinery nearing completion; petrochemical section in last stage
content: The ₹72,937-crore refinery project was caught in a political quagmire after its foundation stone was laid by Sonia Gandhi in 2013, while the BJP government, which came to power subsequently, stalled it to renegotiate the terms with HPCL

title: Badri-Kedar Temple Committee seeking legal advice over construction of replica of Kedarnath temple in Samajwadi Party’s bastion Etawah
content: SP Chief Akhilesh Yadav laid the foundation stone of the Kedareshwar Mahadev Temple in Etawah in 2021, which looks like a replica of the Kadarnath temple

title: Two-week capacity building programme concludes at Central University of Karnataka
content: ‘The development of any nation depends on its capacity for research and innovation. If we are to achieve the goal of ‘Viksit Bharat,’ we must ensure that the benefits of quality research reach the last person in society’

title: Legal provision needed to ensure journalists’ wages, says Sharan Prakash Patil
content: Expressing concerns over job security and low wages of journalists, Minister for Medical Education and Skill Development Sharan Prakash Patil stresses the need for a legal mechanism at the national level to ensure that journalists receive fair and timely wages

title: ADG Kundan Krishnan apologises for linking criminal incidents with farmers
content: In a brief video message posted on Bihar Police official ‘X’ handle Mr. Krishnan said that he had “great respect for those involved in farming” and blamed the controversy on “distorted” representation of his remarks

title: NHAI tests ‘glass grid’ technology to prevent cracks on Chennai-Bengaluru highway
content: The technology was designed by the Indian Institute of Technology-Madras for NHAI; it is expected to prevent cracks on surface

title: CPI has rejected invite to join AIADMK front, says R. Mutharasan
content: He questions if AIADMK general secretary Edappadi K. Palaniswami supports the policies of the BJP-led Centre

title: Stalin has plunged Tamil Nadu into unprecedented debt, says Palaniswami
content: He alleges that the DMK government has borrowed over ₹5 lakh crore since coming to power this term and warns that the burden of repayment would fall on the people

title: VMC Commissioner calls for stricter ban on single-use plastic
content: Starting from government offices, schools, colleges, a mandatory plastic ban should be implemented with the cooperation of the people and business organisations, says Dhyanachandra

title: Centre organises national workshop on Jain Manuscriptology at Gujarat University
content: The workshop brought together key scholars and officials to explore and celebrate the profound intellectual and spiritual legacy embedded in Jain manuscripts

title: Andhra Pradesh government will extend all support to industries, says Minister
content: T.G. Bharath visits Atchutapuram SEZ and Nakkapalli cluster; reviews major projects, promises redressal of industry issues and faster clearances

title: Outrage over attempts to kill teen girl by setting her on fire in Odisha
content: Opposition BJD, Congress come down heavily on Mohan Majhi-led BJP government saying Odisha was becoming highly unsafe for women due to government inaction; govt. says such an attack is not acceptable in any civilised society

title: INDIA bloc parties resolve to question foreign policy ‘failures’ of government
content: Leaders of 24 parties hold online meeting to chalk out strategy for the Monsoon Session of Parliament; a discussion on the Pahalgam terror attack, statehood for J&K, the electoral rolls revision in Bihar and delimitation among issues to be raised

title: PSU dividends to Centre almost double since 2020; over 40% comes from five fuel PSUs
content: IOC, BPCL see 255% hike in payouts to Centre, benefiting from 65% crash in crude rates, but only pass on 2% drop in retail petrol prices; faced with slow disinvestment, Centre mandates high dividends from top PSUs

title: "She Slipped...": Man Whose Wife Fell To Death From Terrace While Joking
content: A 22-year-old woman fell from the fourth floor of a building while sitting on the terrace's ledge, playfully asking her husband whether he would catch her if she slipped.

title: Singapore Faces "Serious" China-Linked Cyberattack
content: Singapore announced it was battling a "serious" cyberattack against its critical infrastructure, attributing the hack to an espionage group that experts have linked to China.

title: In INDIA Bloc's Virtual Meet, Some Complaints And Demands: 10 Points
content: Top leaders of the Opposition INDIA bloc held a virtual meeting on Saturday to decide what issues they should take up during the monsoon session of parliament. The meeting resembled a complaint session with many disagreements, sources said.

title: China Begins Construction Of Mega-Dam On Brahmaputra River In Tibet
content: China started building a mega-dam Saturday on a river running through Tibet and India, with Premier Li Qiang attending the commencement ceremony, state media said.

title: Video: Delta Airlines Boeing 767 Makes Emergency Landing After Engine Catches Fire
content: A Delta Air Lines flight bound for Atlanta had to make an emergency landing back to Los Angeles International Airport (LAX) after an engine reportedly caught fire shortly after take-off on Friday.

title: Soldier Kills Lover, Surrenders At Police Station Where She Was Posted
content: A woman police officer in Gujarat's Kutch district was allegedly murdered by her live-in partner, a CRPF constable, on Friday night.

title: Bihar Voter Roll Revision: 95.92% Electors Covered In Draft Electoral List
content: The Election Commission on Friday said that 95.92% of electors in Bihar have been covered under the draft electoral list as part of the ongoing Special Intensive Revision (SIR) exercise, with six more days remaining.

title: Class 10 Student Hangs Self Over Nagging By Parents Due To Smoking In Rajasthan: Cops
content: A class 12 student was found hanging from the ceiling fan of his rented home in the Pratap Nagar area here, with police suspecting that he ended his life over nagging by his parents for smoking.

title: Jagdeep Dhankar Slams "Outside Narratives" In Speech To Defence Trainees
content: Jagdeep Dhankhar on Saturday addressed the 2024 batch of Indian Defence Estates Service (IDES) officer trainees at the Vice-President's Enclave, delivering a forceful speech underlining India's sovereign decision-making and civilisational ethos.

title: Trump Takes Step Forward On Epstein Files, Then Rants About "Left Lunatics"
content: In a fiery Truth Social post on Saturday, US President Donald Trump announced that he has formally asked the Justice Department to release all grand jury testimony related to the Jeffrey Epstein case-subject to court approval.

title: INDIA Bloc Parties Hold Online Meeting Ahead Of Parliament's Monsoon Session
content: INDIA bloc parties on Saturday held deliberations at an online meeting to reach a consensus on issues that they would raise to corner the government during Parliament's Monsoon session beginning July 21 and convey a message of unity.

title: South Korea's Yoon Indicted On Additional Criminal Charges Over Martial Law
content: South Korea's ousted conservative President Yoon Suk Yeol was indicted Saturday on additional criminal charges related to his ill-fated imposition of martial law, about three months after he was formally thrown out of office.

title: "Very Dangerous": Israel Rejects Syrian Interim President's Renewed Pledge
content: Israel on Saturday dismissed a renewed pledge by Syria's interim President Ahmed al-Sharaa to protect minorities after deadly sectarian clashes, saying it was "very dangerous" to be a minority in the country.

title: Footwear Fashioned From Rubber Tires As Economic Crisis Hits South Sudan
content: In South Sudan, however, the creative work of such artisans is now fueled by an economic crisis that has left the government on the verge of bankruptcy and many people struggling to put food on the table.

title: Punjab Man Fires Gunshots At Birthday Party In Hotel, Case Filed: Cops
content: A case was filed against a man in Punjab for celebratory firing during a birthday party in Zirakpur, a town in Mohali, after a video of the incident surfaced on social media, prompting police action.

title: Millions At Risk After Trump's Funding Cut Stalls Water Projects Globally
content: The Trump administration's decision to slash nearly all U.S. foreign aid has left dozens of water and sanitation projects half-finished across the globe.

title: In Bihar Voter Roll Revision, 41 Lakh Now At Risk Of Exclusion
content: With just six days to go for submitting enumeration forms for the special intensive revision (SIR) of electoral rolls in Bihar, over 41 lakh voters now risk being excluded from the final list, up from 35.6 lakh earlier this week.

title: Tourist Boat Capsizes During Thunderstorm In Vietnam Killing 34; 8 Missing
content: A boat carrying tourists capsized during a sudden thunderstorm in Vietnam on Saturday afternoon during a sightseeing excursion, killing 34 people, state media reported. Eight others remain missing.

title: Odisha Launches 'Shaktishree' Initiative For Women's Safety On Campus
content: Odisha Chief Minister Mohan Charan Majhi on Saturday launched 'Shaktishree', a state-wide initiative to ensure the safety, security, and empowerment of women in universities and colleges.

title: Prepared To Shift Minor Set On Fire To AIIMS Delhi: Odisha Chief Minister
content: Odisha Chief Minister Mohan Charan Majhi on Saturday said that the state government will airlift the minor girl, who was set on fire by miscreants in Puri, to AIIMS Delhi for advanced medical care as per the advice of the doctors.

title: Karnataka Tourism Dept. to soon launch waterfall tours
content: The destinations have been identified in Hassan, Chikkamagaluru, Dakshina Kannada, Uttara Kannada, Shivamogga, Kodagu and Belagavi

title: India’s water will now flow only for its people, asserts J&K L-G on Indus Waters Treaty’s abeyance
content: L-G Manoj Sinha made these remarks while releasing author Sant Kumar Sharma’s book Indus Waters Treaty: Mirroring the Facts; he said it was for the first time since Pakistan fought three wars with India in 1965, 1971 and 1999 that the treaty was abandoned

title: Arrest of Indian fishermen lays bare uneasy Delhi-Dhaka ties
content: Policymakers view the arrests as an “absence of understanding” between India and Bangladesh following the fall of the Hasina government. They say that an “unwritten understanding” regarding fishermen is no longer being honoured

title: Stateless for four years, doctor from Pakistan knocks on Gujarat High Court’s door for citizenship
content: Nanikraz Khanoomal Mukhi, 50, moved to India in 2009 for his children’s education and to escape possible religious persecution; after settling down in Ahmedabad, where he has relatives, Dr. Mukhi applied for citizenship in 2016 but it has been elusive

title: SIT arrests YSRCP’s Rajampet MP Midhun Reddy in Andhra Pradesh liquor scam
content: Named Accused No. 4 in the case, Midhun Reddy is charged with playing a key role in the multi-crore scam, conspiring with the other accused to divert the money collected from the distillery companies; he will be produced in the ACB Special Court in Vijayawada on July 20

title: Uproar over patient in oxygen mask sitting on the floor in U.P. Azamgarh hospital
content: A video shows a patient on the floor allegedly due to lack of beds in an Azamgarh hospital; Congress leader Anil Yadav raises concerns about healthcare in Uttar Pradesh

title: Defending land, not pushing divisive agenda: Assam CM counters Mamata
content: Unchecked infiltration of Muslims from across the border has already caused a demographic shift, Himanta Biswa Sarma says

title: Under attack from Opposition, BJP govt. in Odisha launches ‘Shaktishree’ for safety of girls in colleges
content: After the self-immolation death of a girl over alleged sexual harassment, the State government proposes to establish ‘Shaktishree Empowerment Cell’ in all universities and colleges in the State. Chief Minister Mohan Majhi says the initiative is in response to the rise in crimes against girl students

title: Karnataka govt. notifies draft on setting up five corporations in Bengaluru
content: The draft splits the civic limits into five corporations - Central, North, East, West, and South corporations, of varying sizes in terms of area, population, population density, and even projected property tax potential of these corporations

title: Over 500 personnel to be deployed in Aluva for ‘Karkidaka Vavu Bali’
content: The Fort Kochi Sub-Collector and the Muvattupuzha Revenue Divisional Officer have been assigned to oversee the arrangements

title: Restoration work at Srinagar’s Vachar Nag Temple begins
content: J&K Chief Secretary and Srinagar DC initiate restoration of historic Vachar Nag Temple, which was abandoned in the 1990s when Kashmiri Pandits left the Valley in the wake of rising militancy

title: NIRF to award mild penalty to institutions for retractions this year, harsh penalty next year
content: By awarding a negative score for retractions, we want to send out a strong message that research should be conducted ethically, says Anil Sahashrabudhe, Chairperson of the National Board of Accreditation

title: Andhra Pradesh liquor scam: CID police file chargesheet in ACB Special Court
content: Police summon former Deputy Chief Minister and Excise Minister Narayana Swamy in the liquor scam on July 21

title: CPI MP seeks NIA probe into Dharmasthala ‘crimes’
content: Rajya Sabha member P. Sandosh Kumar on July 19 wrote to Amit Shah to probe the pattern of crimes in Dharmasthala

title: Family from Birbhum deported to Bangladesh, says West Bengal migrant board Chief
content: ‘We were arrested in Delhi, where we had gone to work. We showed our Aadhaar card and said we are not Bangladeshi nationals, but the police threatened us saying that they will make us Bangladeshis,” says Sweety Bibi a resident of Paikar police station in West Bengal Birbhum district

title: Around 32 lakh voters yet to submit enumeration forms in Bihar, says Election Commission
content: ‘A concerted effort by the entire electoral machinery along with yet another round of visits by the BLOs has also been started to establish contact with the remaining electors,’ said the poll body

title: Not said anything against the Gandhi family, says Shashi Tharoor on Emergency article
content: Mr. Tharoor said that lot of people were critical of him because of the stance that he had taken supporting the Armed forces and the Union government on what happened recently in our borders

title: Lokesh tells CAs to be acquainted and updated with their subject
content: Institute of Chartered Accountants of India remains an accounting powerhouse and has been a major strength of the Indian financial system, says IT and HRD Minister

title: Plans afoot to resume SLBC tunnel work soon as Irrigation Dept. ropes in experts from Army
content: Rescue work in SLBC tunnel from Domalapenta side was halted in April-end after recovering 2 out of 8 bodies of workers who were buried alive on Feb. 22 following roof collapse

title: ICMR seeks collaboration for malaria vaccine production through tech transfer
content: The collaborator will have access to ICMR’s technology to develop ‘a recombinant chimeric multi-stage malaria vaccine’. The Council will provide technical support through its team of experienced scientists through various stages such as study planning, product development and outcome assessment

title: Calicut varsity’s Board of Studies, academic council to take final call on exclusion of Vedan’s song from syllabus
content: Vice-Chancellor says there is nothing political about the proposals and it is an academic issue. He says the core question is whether students learning Malayalam literature should engage in a comparative study of music

title: Nobody owns house or land in this village recorded as ‘proposed forest’ in Shivamogga
content: Villagers at Karimane say they have not been allowed to build houses because it is forestland, but the applications submitted under the Forest Rights Act are also pending

title: Congress to stage ‘economic blockade’ to protest Chaitanya Baghel’s arrest
content: Bhupesh Baghel said the arrest was a conspiracy to finish the Congress leadership and facilitate the handover of the State’s natural resources to the Adani Group

title: Centre’s move to permit large vessels beyond maritime zone draws flak from fishers
content: Allowing large vessels will enable deep-sea fishing to tap the hitherto untapped resources, says govt.

title: Massive tree felling reported from Cardamom Hill Reserve land in Idukki
content: Around 440 trees were cut recently under the guise of cardamom replanting on the plots situated close to the Mathikettan Shola National Park

title: Supreme Court to hear Presidential reference on President, Governor’s powers on July 22
content: The reference asks whether judicial orders can impose timelines, dictate functioning of the President and the Governors when dealing with State Bills; questions April 8 judgment deeming assent for Tamil Nadu Bills

title: Maradu municipality charges ₹2 lakh penalty for illegal waste dumping
content: The health wing identified the culprits based on information from residents who saw them dumping the waste, says municipal chairman

title: Scheffler up 4, closes in on first title at The Open
content: Scottie Scheffler moved within one round of claiming the third leg of the Grand Slam on Saturday when he made an eagle and two big par saves for a 4-under 67 in The Open that gave him a four-shot lead at Royal Portrush.

title: Rory makes late charge with wild round at Open
content: Rory, spurred on by the thousands of Northern Irish fans at Royal Portrush, posted a 66 to head into Sunday six shots back of leader Scottie Scheffler.

title: Still unsigned, Bengals DE Stewart doesn't report
content: Bengals defensive end Shemar Stewart is the lone first-round pick in this year's draft class who has not signed his rookie deal.

title: Saints 2nd-rounder Shough gets guaranteed deal
content: Saints quarterback Tyler Shough, selected 40th overall, becomes the latest second-rounder to be given a fully guaranteed rookie contract.

title: USC's Watkins leads 13 new Unrivaled signings
content: Unrivaled announced 13 new NIL deal signings Saturday, led by USC's JuJu Watkins, along with the continuation of a Flau'jae Johnson partnership.

title: Judge dismisses Pryor-led OSU lawsuit vs. NCAA
content: An Ohio judge ruled that former Ohio State quarterback Terrelle Pryor filed his proposed class action against the NCAA, Ohio State and others too late.

title: Source: Miller gets $6.1M in Commanders deal
content: Von Miller, who agreed to a deal with the Commanders this week, will earn $6.1 million and can make up to $10.5 million through incentives, a source confirmed to ESPN.

title: 28 years later, Brits get relay gold from DQ'd U.S.
content: Britain's men's 4x400-meter relay team was presented with the gold medal from the 1997 world championships, having been elevated from silver after the belated disqualification of the U.S. team.

title: 💎 Eagles' Super Bowl ring has pop-out wings
content: The Eagles' Super Bowl LIX rings feature a hidden button that, when pressed, extends the wings on either side, revealing coach Nick Sirianni's saying, "You can't be great without the greatness of others."

title: WNBA All-Star Game: Predictions, live updates and analysis from Indianapolis
content: Team Collier looks like the favorite over Team Clark in Saturday's WNBA All-Star Game. What are the must-see matchups?

title: Usyk vs. Dubois live updates, results and analysis
content: Oleksandr Usyk looks to regain the undisputed heavyweight championship against Daniel Dubois. Follow live.

title: NBA summer league standouts: Flagg, Harper, Hansen and surprise stars
content: From Cooper Flagg to veteran players, Kevin Pelton hands out superlatives for 2025 NBA summer league.

title: Five overreactions before 2025 NFL season: Commanders win NFC East? Chiefs lose AFC West?
content: Is the Bucs QB destined for a massive new contract? Will the Commanders own the NFC East? We're judging offseason overreactions.

title: Big Ten preview: Can Penn State finally break through? Will Ohio State repeat?
content: As the Big Ten looks to produce its third straight national champion, Bill Connelly breaks down all 18 teams.

title: WNBA All-Star grades: Liberty's Ionescu, Cloud sweep 3-point, skills challenge crowns
content: Natasha Cloud won the WNBA All-Star skills challenge. Sabrina Ionescu won the 3-point contest. We grade every competitor.

title: Timeline: Caitlin Clark's injury-riddled first half of the WNBA season
content: Three separate injuries have sidelined the Indiana point guard and All-Star for 10 regular-season WNBA games.

title: 'We couldn't chance it': Why the Suns and Bradley Beal finally came to terms
content: One element of the Suns' roster failure has loomed: How to end their marriage to the three-time All-Star.

title: Source: USMNT's Sargent close to Wolfsburg move
content: USMNT forward Josh Sargent is on the verge of joining Bundesliga side Wolfsburg for a deal worth in excess of €21 million, a source has told ESPN.

title: Sources: Rashford close to Barcelona loan move
content: Marcus Rashford is on the verge of a seasonlong loan move to Barcelona after Man United gave permission for him to open talks, sources told ESPN.

title: Amorim admits United lack pace after Leeds draw
content: Ruben Amorim admitted Manchester United lacked pace and need to improve in the final third, as they began their preseason campaign with a goalless draw against Leeds.

title: Isak missed game due to speculation - Howe
content: Newcastle United manager Eddie Howe said Alexander Isak missed the 4-0 preseason defeat against Celtic due to speculation linking him with a transfer.

title: No Madueke, Gyökeres for Arsenal preseason tour
content: Arsenal have departed for their pre-season tour to Asia without Viktor Gyökeres as talks continue with Sporting Lisbon over a move for the striker.

title: De Bruyne on Prem exit: I'm a City player for life
content: Kevin De Bruyne is raring to go at Napoli after not being offered a contract extension by Man City, and said linking up with Romelu Lukaku was key.

title: Spain reach semifinals despite missing 2 penalties
content: Spain overcame missing two penalties to beat hosts Switzerland 2-0 on Friday to reach the Women's Euro semifinals for just the second time.

title: Masche on Messi, All-Stars: 'Would prefer rest'
content: Inter Miami head coach Javier Mascherano said he would prefer that Lionel Messi and Jordi Alba not participate in the 2025 MLS All-Star Game, insisting players should be resting amid the ongoing regular season.

title: The USMNT's to-do list before the 2026 World Cup, ranked by urgency
content: The USMNT's failure at the Gold Cup makes it clear changes are needed before the 2026 World Cup. Here are the five keys, ranked by urgency.

title: Weah to Marseille, Reyna to anywhere but Dortmund? Best transfer fits for USMNT stars
content: What moves, if any, should these eight USMNT players make to ensure they'll be in top form next summer?

title: What it's like boxing Pacquiao, and how he can beat Barrios
content: Timothy Bradley Jr. shares his thoughts about fighting Manny Pacquiao and breaks down Saturday's fight.

title: AFC North intrigue: Will Ravens be first to three-peat? Will Rodgers snap Tomlin's playoff skid?
content: The AFC North is loaded with intrigue and talent, from Lamar Jackson to Joe Burrow and now Aaron Rodgers. Here's what to know.

title: Chiefs QB Patrick Mahomes ready to enter new era: Turning 30
content: Mahomes has won two MVPs and three Super Bowls in his 20s. He'll turn 30 as he starts his ninth NFL season.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United, Newcastle in for Randal Kolo Muani
content: Manchester United and Newcastle United are ready to make a move for Paris Saint-Germain striker Randal Kolo Muani. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Ranking the top 25 college football recruits regardless of class
content: Why let rising seniors get all the glory? We break down the best prospects in the country, including underclassmen.

title: How five-star prospects Jason Crowe, JaShawn Andrews﻿ fit at Mizzou, Arkansas
content: Breaking down the fits of every top class of 2026 commitment, beginning with No. 4 Jason Crowe and No. 12 JJ Andrews﻿

title: Updated top 10 prospect rankings for all 30 MLB teams -- with 2025 draft picks included!
content: Who is rising and falling in every major league farm system after the MLB draft? Kiley McDaniel digs in.

title: 'Sad.' 'Embarrassing.' Why players were a no-show at the MLB draft
content: Moving the draft to All-Star week was supposed to give it some sizzle. But not one player was in attendance.

title: From Skylar Diggins to Eric Gordon: Ranking Indiana's top high school hoopers since 2000
content: As part of SportsCenter's "50 States in 50 Days" tour, we're spotlighting the top boys and girls hoopers to come out of Indiana based on high school career achievements.

title: Minister orders probe into parents’ complaint
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: Bihar: Senior police officer apologises for blaming crime on farmers; denies intent to malign
content: Additional Director General of Police, Kundan Krishnan, apologized for linking increased crime rates to the agricultural lean season, claiming his statement was taken out of context. He expressed respect for farmers, emphasizing their vital role and his own family's agricultural background. Krishnan clarified that criminals are solely responsible for crimes, regardless of caste or religion.

title: ED not a ‘loitering munition’ or ‘super cop’: Madras HC
content: The Madras High Court has strongly criticized the Enforcement Directorate (ED), likening it to a limpet mine dependent on a 'ship' of predicate offense. The court quashed ED's ₹901-crore fixed deposit freeze order, emphasizing that PMLA actions require a scheduled offense and proceeds of crime.

title: UP cops ban kanwariyas from carrying trishuls and hockey sticks during yatra
content: Uttar Pradesh police have prohibited kanwariyas from carrying sticks and tridents. This ban affects districts like Meerut and Muzaffarnagar. The decision follows incidents of vandalism involving kanwariyas. Authorities are enforcing the ban strictly, registering FIRs against violators. Recent incidents include kanwariyas brandishing swords and vandalizing property. Police in Muzaffarnagar have seized bikes lacking silencers.

title: 'Desh se badhkar kuch nahi hota': Shikhar Dhawan boycotts IND vs PAK clash
content: Shikhar Dhawan has withdrawn from the India vs Pakistan match in the World Championship of Legends 2025, citing the Pahalgam terror attack as the reason. He reaffirmed his May 11 decision to abstain from playing against Pakistan due to geopolitical tensions. Dhawan's stance reflects his prioritisation of national sentiment over sporting commitments.

title: Kiss Cam fallout: Astronomer breaks silence on CEO-HR video; says Andy Byron has not been…
content: Astronomer, a New York-based AI company, is investigating CEO Andy Byron and HR head Kristin Cabot after a viral video showed them in a compromising situation at a Coldplay concert. Following the incident, cofounder Pete DeJoy has been appointed as interim CEO, as Byron has been placed on leave.

title: Baghel’s son laundered Rs 16.7 crore through shell firms: ED to court
content: The ED arrested Chaitanya Baghel, son of ex-Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel, for allegedly laundering Rs 16.7 crore in connection to a Rs 2,100 crore liquor scam. Congress party has called for statewide protests. Baghel accuses the Centre of vendetta politics, while Priyanka Gandhi Vadra alleges the arrest is to suppress Baghel's raising of the Adani forest issue.

title: China’s ‘Leave India’ order to engineers: Trade body’s SOS to govt; what the letter says
content: India's electronics industry is sounding alarms over China's alleged informal trade restrictions, fearing a crippling blow to its global competitiveness and a $32 billion smartphone export target. The ICEA, representing major manufacturers, claims China's actions deliberately undermine India's manufacturing rise, causing delays and increased costs.

title: Menace in the sky: UP villagers chase drones with sticks & stones
content: A drone flying over a jail in Uttar Pradesh has sparked widespread fear and suspicion. Residents across multiple districts are reporting strange lights and drones, leading to rooftop vigils and heightened anxiety. While police investigate potential links to thefts and monitor drone activity, villagers remain vigilant, fearing they are under surveillance.

title: Phuket-bound Air India Express flight returns to Hyderabad after takeoff
content: An Air India Express flight IX 110, carrying over 100 passengers to Phuket, Thailand, made an emergency return to Hyderabad airport shortly after takeoff due to a technical issue. The Boeing aircraft, which had already faced a 20-minute delay, departed at 6:40 am but landed back by 6:57 am.

title: Skills beyond degrees: Google Android head to engineers; You’ll go far if you have…
content: Google's Android head, Sameer Samat, advises aspiring engineers that a computer science degree isn't enough to secure top tech jobs. He stresses the importance of developing deep expertise in areas of genuine passion beyond formal education. Samat believes computer science should focus on problem-solving, system design, and collaboration, not just coding, as AI increasingly automates basic programming tasks.

title: India-EFTA to take effect from October 1: Goyal
content: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal announced that the India-EFTA Trade and Economic Partnership Agreement (TEPA) will be implemented from October 1st. Signed on March 10, 2024, the pact includes a USD 100 billion investment commitment from the EFTA nations over 15 years. India will also lower or eliminate duties on certain products like Swiss watches and diamonds.

title: Shannon Sharpe’s alleged $50 million assault case ends in settlement
content: Shannon Sharpe has settled a $50 million sexual assault lawsuit filed by a 20-year-old woman, raising questions among fans. While Sharpe's legal team affirmed a consensual relationship, the settlement has fueled speculation about his guilt. Both parties acknowledge a long-term, tumultuous relationship, leading to a mutually agreed-upon resolution and dismissal of the lawsuit.

title: How Travis Kelce came 'closer than ever' to marriage with Taylor Swift
content: Pop singer Taylor Swift's father, Scott Swift, underwent quintuple bypass surgery. During this difficult time, her boyfriend, Travis Kelce, provided significant support. He helped Taylor cope with the situation. He also took care of practical needs. Sources say Kelce's actions have strengthened their relationship. There is speculation about a possible engagement. Fans are excited about their future together.

title: Man accused in minor’s gang-rape acquitted after 8 yrs in jail
content: Dhanpal Kashyap, wrongly accused in a 2017 gang-rape case in Bareilly, was acquitted after eight years in jail due to lack of evidence and the survivor's testimony. Represented by a court-appointed lawyer after years of struggling to afford one, he now seeks compensation for the ruined years.

title: With juvenile on board, pay 2x fine for breaking traffic rules
content: The road transport ministry is considering doubling penalties for traffic violations when children are present, aiming to enhance safety and accountability. A "merit and demerit" point system is also proposed, linking insurance premiums to driving behavior and potentially suspending licenses for excessive violations. Furthermore, drivers with traffic violations may face mandatory retesting upon license renewal.

title: Debate over having Sikh Regiment in British Army resurfaces
content: The debate regarding the establishment of a Sikh regiment within the British armed forces has been reignited, despite the Ministry of Defence's insistence that no such plans are underway due to anti-discrimination laws. Lord Sahota argues that a Sikh regiment wouldn't violate the Equality Act and could boost ethnic minority recruitment, fostering stronger ties with countries like India.

title: J&K Congress vows to take statehood fight to Delhi
content: Authorities in Srinagar prevented a Congress march demanding the restoration of full statehood to Jammu and Kashmir by deploying heavy security outside the party headquarters. Congress leaders criticized the action as undemocratic, alleging that workers were blocked from reaching Srinagar.

title: 'Strategic location': Govt plans defence 'takeover' of Lakshadweep island
content: The Lakshadweep administration plans to acquire Bitra Island for defense purposes, sparking opposition from residents and MP Hamdullah Sayeed. A social impact assessment has been ordered by the revenue department, citing the island's strategic location and national security relevance.

title: Team India arrives in Manchester via train, takes last moment U-turn and walks 300m in rain
content: The side will now begin preparations at the Old Trafford Ground in Manchester with sessions tomorrow, the day after, and on the eve of the match. The first session will be behind closed doors without any access to the media, just like it happened for two sessions in Birmingham, and doors will be opened for the morning session on July 21 and the afternoon hit on July 22.

title: Ineos driver hits spectator while chasing Thymen Arensman up the Col de Peyresourde
content: During stage 14 of the Tour de France, an Ineos Grenadiers team car, driven by sports director Oliver Cookson, struck a spectator on the Col de Peyresourde. The incident occurred as the car trailed Thymen Arensman, who went on to win the stage. Cookson was fined and received a yellow card, while French police launched an investigation.

title: 'Idea was to ...': VP Dhankhar explains why India chose to pause Op Sindoor
content: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar asserted that India makes independent decisions, uninfluenced by external powers. He emphasized that Operation Sindoor, India's counter-terror action, is ongoing in various forms, initiated to instill sanity and humanity. Dhankhar cautioned citizens against external narratives, affirming India's sovereignty and its commitment to peaceful coexistence within the global community, guided by mutual respect and diplomatic dialogue.

title: Jasprit Bumrah's replacement for 4th Test revealed
content: Veteran Indian cricketer Ajinkya Rahane has suggested that left-arm pacer Arshdeep Singh should step in if Jasprit Bumrah is rested. Arshdeep, who has picked up 99 wickets in 63 T20Is, is still awaiting his Test debut. However, his participation in Manchester has been thrown into doubt due to an injury suffered during a practice session.

title: Dhoni and Kohli left out! Raina picks his all-time World XI; four Indians included
content: Suresh Raina unveiled his World Playing XI for the World Championship of Legends 2025, surprisingly omitting MS Dhoni and Virat Kohli. His team features legends like Brian Lara, Sachin Tendulkar, and a spin-heavy bowling attack including Shane Warne, Anil Kumble, and Harbhajan Singh. Raina is set to participate in the WCL 2025, marking his return to competitive cricket.

title: Canada wildfires burn area the size of Croatia
content: Canada's wildfires have burned more than 13.6 million acres (5.5 million hectares) this year, an area roughly the size of Croatia, officials said Friday as the country endures one of its most destructive fire seasons.  According to figures dating back to 1983, Canada's second most destructive fire season was 1995, when 17.5 million acres burned, a mark that may be passed this year.

title: 'She is very talented': Melania Trump praises Taylor Swift
content: In a surprising turn of events in the summer of 2025, Melania Trump publicly praised Taylor Swift's talent during a visit to a children's hospital, despite Donald Trump's critical remarks. Simultaneously, Swift and Travis Kelce were spotted enjoying a low-key lunch date in Ohio, showcasing their genuine connection away from the spotlight.

title: Dwyane Wade shares serene retreat — celebrates daughter Kaavia’s country moment
content: Dwyane Wade shares glimpses of his family moments. He posts videos of daughter Kaavia with a pony. Gabrielle Union is also seen in the video. Wade also shares a serene sea view from his vacation home. He emphasizes the importance of freedom for Kaavia. Wade and Union foster compassion and individuality in their parenting.

title: Bill Belichick Hulu doc drama — Did Jordon Hudson spark the deal?
content: Bill Belichick's surprising move to UNC football is now a Hulu docuseries after initial Hard Knocks talks fell through due to creative differences. Belichick and his camp, including his girlfriend Jordon Hudson, reportedly sought more control over the show's final edit. The series promises a look at his coaching debut, potential branding efforts, and a glimpse into his personal life.

title: Odisha shocker: Miscreants set 15-year-old girl on fire, in critical condition
content: In a shocking incident, a fifteen-year-old girl was attacked in Puri district. Three miscreants set her on fire. The victim is now in critical condition at AIIMS Bhubaneswar. Local residents helped her and took her to the hospital. Deputy Chief Minister Pravati Parida has assured full government support for her treatment.

title: Saiyaara box office collection: Film inches closer to Rs 40 crore mark
content: Against expectations, 'Saiyaara,' starring Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, has become a hit, earning ₹31.71 crore in two days. Strong word-of-mouth is driving audience interest, with occupancy rates rising. The film initially had a solo run but will face competition from 'Dhadak 2' on August 1, after 'Son of Sardaar 2' postponed its release.

title: HDFC Bank first-ever 1:1 bonus issue: Bank announces Rs 5 special dividend
content: HDFC Bank announced its first-ever 1:1 bonus issue and a special interim dividend of Rs 5 per share alongside its Q1FY26 results. The bank reported a 12% year-on-year increase in standalone net profit, reaching Rs 18,155 crore. The record date for the bonus issue is August 27, 2025, and for the dividend, it's July 25, 2025.

title: Electrocuted or murdered? Wife, brother-in-law held for Delhi jeweller’s death
content: Delhi Police have launched a murder investigation into the death of Karan Dev, initially believed to be accidental electrocution. Suspicion arose after inconsistencies were found in the wife's statements and forensic evidence. Dev's brother raised concerns, prompting a deeper inquiry. The wife and brother-in-law have been apprehended and are being questioned.

title: 'I don’t need an apology': Niemann after making his maiden Freestyle final on debut
content: Hans Niemann is in the final of the Freestyle Chess Grand Slam. He defeated Fabiano Caruana in the semi-final. Niemann will face Levon Aronian for the title. The tournament is happening in Las Vegas. Magnus Carlsen and Hikaru Nakamura are competing for third place. Niemann aims to prove himself after his controversy with Carlsen.

title: Why Drake Maye can be a top-10 QB in 2025
content: in 11 starts from Week 6 to Week 17, Drake Maye threw for 2,254 yards, 15 touchdowns and 10 interceptions . that translated to an average of 16.0 fantasy points per game in those starts, which would have ranked just outside the top 12 quarterbacks over a full season . Maye has all the makings of a top-10 fantasy quarterback .
